docs.lead_paragraph: President Barack Obama called for higher taxes on wealthy Americans and new initiatives to boost the middle class as he urged Americans to turn the page on years of economic woes and hard-fought wars in his sixth State of the Union address before Congress. Some highlights from Obama's proposals:

headline.print_headline: State of the Union: Highlights From Obama's Address

docs.lead_paragraph: Wal-Mart is launching a service allowing customers to pick up their tax refunds in cash at all stores nationwide.

headline.main: Wal-Mart Launches Cash Pickup Option for Tax Refunds
headline.print_headline: Wal-Mart Launches Cash Pickup Option for Tax Refunds

headline.main: Analysis of Obama's State of the Union Address

docs.abstract: The president highlighted progress on the economy, U.S.-Cuba relations and gas prices, and he called for a renewed focus on economic inequality.
docs.snippet: The president highlighted progress on the economy, U.S.-Cuba relations and gas prices, and he called for a renewed focus on economic inequality.

headline.main: Meeting the Baby, Becoming a Family

docs.abstract: From the moment we met our daughter, weighing two-and-a-half pounds and wearing a red bow pasted on her head, we could tell she was the fighter and “rock star” we’d been told about.
docs.snippet: From the moment we met our daughter, weighing two-and-a-half pounds and wearing a red bow pasted on her head, we could tell she was the fighter and “rock star” we’d been told about.

docs.lead_paragraph: The strong dollar and stiff competition for some products squeezed Johnson & Johnson in the fourth quarter and it missed Wall Street expectations for revenue, triggering a rare sell-off of its shares.

docs.lead_paragraph: The government's health insurance website is quietly sending consumers' personal data to private companies that specialize in advertising and analyzing Internet data for performance and marketing, The Associated Press has learned.

docs.lead_paragraph: Refusing to bend to the new Republican Congress, President Barack Obama unveiled Tuesday night an ambitious State of the Union agenda steeped in Democratic priorities, including tax increases on the wealthy, education and child care help for the middle class and a torrent of veto threats for the GOP's own plans.

docs.lead_paragraph: Beijing, which reported growth of 7.4 percent for 2014, below its target of 7.5 percent, is trying to reduce its dependence on credit-fueled investment and government spending.

headline.main: As Growth Slows, China Pins Hopes on Consumer Spending
headline.print_headline: As Growth Slows, China Pins Hopes on Consumer Spending

docs.abstract: China's economy grew by 7.3 percent in fourth quarter 2014 and 7.4 percent for full year, missing its goal of 7.5 percent; nation is pinning hopes on consumer spending to drive growth; spending constitutes 36 percent of gross domestic product.
docs.snippet: Beijing, which reported growth of 7.4 percent for 2014, below its target of 7.5 percent, is trying to reduce its dependence on credit-fueled investment and government spending.

byline.contributor: Michael Forsythe contributed reporting from Hong Kong. Mia Li contributed research.
